instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A2141: What is A2141? A2141 is a model number for a 16 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2019 with EMC 3347, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01700..
definitions.820-01700: What is 820-01700? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP5V_G3S: What is PP5V_G3S? PP5V_G3S is a 5v power rail present when the system is in a G3S standby state.
definitions.PP1V8_S5: What is PP1V8_S5? PP1V8_S5 is a 1.8v power rail present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state. .
definitions.P3V3G3S_EN: What is P3V3G3S_EN? P3VG3S_EN is a signal that turns on the PP3V3_G3S power rail. Signals with _EN on the end enable whatever came before the _EN if the signal is high. .
definitions.PP2V5_NAND_SSD0: What is PP2V5_NAND_SSD0? PP2V5_NAND_SSD0 This is a power rail that powers the NAND on Macbooks where the solid state drive is soldered directly to the board. .
definitions.PP2V5_NAND_SSD1: What is PP2V5_NAND_SSD1? PP2V5_NAND_SSD1 is a power rail that powers the soldered on SSDs.
definitions.PP0V9_SSD0: What is PP0V9_SSD0? This is a power rail for the soldered on SSD on newer Macbooks. .
definitions.PP1V8_SSD0: What is PP1V8_SSD0? PP1V8_SSD0 is a power rail responsible for powering the soldered on NAND memory for the SSD on newer Macbook Pros.
definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-05 no power
threads.message:
Hi,

I have an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-05 with no power, and shows 20.5V on ampmeter, but 0.04A.

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> = 12.63V
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_G3S</SIGNAL> = 1.8V
<SIGNAL>PP5V_G3S</SIGNAL> = 5.136V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3S_X</SIGNAL> = 3.389V
<SIGNAL>P3V3G3S_EN</SIGNAL> = 1.799V

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> = 0V and 0.324 diode reading
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_S5</SIGNAL> = 0V and 0.356 diode reading

Don't know where to start. Can you help?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-05 no power
threads.message:
Do you get SSD voltages?
Tried DFU?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-05 no power
threads.message:
Hi,

I've tried revive and restore DFU, but always get a comunication error.

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H_SSD0_SNS</SIGNAL> = 12.63V
<SIGNAL>PP2V5_NAND_SSD0</SIGNAL> = 2.528V
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_SSD0</SIGNAL> = 1.803V
<SIGNAL>PP0V9_SSD0</SIGNAL> = 0.901V

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H_SSD1_SNS</SIGNAL> = 12.63V
<SIGNAL>PP0V9_SSD1</SIGNAL> = 0.901V
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_SSD1</SIGNAL> = 1.803V
<SIGNAL>PP2V5_NAND_SSD1</SIGNAL> = 2.525V

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-05 no power
threads.message:
Be sure to use 96/140W charger and also try with good battery connected.
Check for short on secondary power supplies, like RAM, PCH/CPU, GPU; including page 79.

If still the same, try flashing SoC ROM (<CHIP>U4770</CHIP>).

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-05 no power
threads.message:
I'm already using the original charger, and I can't find any short. 

I'll flash Soc ROM.

I have these two files, but don't know the difference bettwen them:

<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A <CHIP>U2890</CHIP>
<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A UB090

Can you help with that?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-05 no power
threads.message:
[QUOTE="hgoncalves, post: 95624, member: 25466"]
<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A <CHIP>U2890</CHIP>
<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A UB090
[/QUOTE]

Those are TBT rom files, you should look for the SoC (<CHIP>U4770</CHIP>) Rom file...

threads.message:
Hi, 

Actualy, now, it only puls 5V from ampmeter.

I left it charging at night, because it seamed that it was charging the battery. Last night, when I went home, it was consuming 2A (it started at 3.6A), and I thought that it was a good idea left it charging. Guess not...

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-05 no power
threads.message:
Hello again.
I don't understand this, but now, without doing anything, It started to pull 20V again, and 0.598A.

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL>  = 0V and no pulse

After a while (~15m) it goes to 5.16V on all ports, and stays there...

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-05 no power
threads.message:
Did you get 20V at any moment on charger alone (no battery)?

You don't need to wait hours to know if battery is charging.
Just monitor <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>.
If charging, it should slowly increase, according with battery level; unless battery is already fully charged.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-05 no power
threads.message:
Yes, right now I have the 20V (charger only).

It seams that whem the battery gets full, It starts to pull 5V only. W/O battery, it stays at 20.5V
